snippet: A federal judge ruled Wednesday that state laws limiting the bargaining power of unions did not violate the free speech and equal protection rights of public sector  workers.
abstract: Federal Judge William M Conley rules that Wisconsin's collective bargaining laws do not violate free speech and equal protection rights of public sector union workers, upholding laws passed in 2011 by Republican lawmakers that severely limited bargaining power of public unions while forcing most state workers to pay more for health insurance and pensions.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge ruled Wednesday that state laws limiting the bargaining power of unions did not violate the free speech and equal protection rights of public sector  workers.
